You may have to transfer 2/3 times between containers however before solvent is clear and no residue sinks to the bottom. Edit: I also reuse the majority of the powder (minus losses) and pestle and mortar the chunks back to powder, heat a second time to ensure all water is out.

I found it easier to pre-dry the magnesium sulfate on a stove using a non-stick pan (e.g. teflon), breaking the clumps manually with spatula. This quickly produces a mix of anhydrous form and small clumps of hydrates. The mix is then transferred to a larger pan (non-stick not necessary) into an oven set to MAX (250-260 degrees centigrade), but 220 is maybe enough, for an hour or so.
